channel.title: Your kidding me... 1337speak in the news?!
channel.description:
These retards telling everyone, basically, that '1337sp34k' will put people who use it in danger..
http://youtube.com/watch?v=_b1cyNigny8

item.title: Your kidding me... 1337speak in the news?!
item.dc:creator: @Martin Martin
item.description:
@Martin wrote:

The Un-Named:

I’ve seen this before. Seriously, it’s fucked up. “leet is short for elite, because it’s common for more advanced computer users”. Look at people with no life that have AOL, they probably don’t know shit about “advanced” computer stuff. I mean I’d put partitioning and shit into the intermediate category and how many people with AOL do you know that can create a partition?

I have AOL and can create a partition… I was smart enough to tell them not to bother sending me the disks when my Dad signed up.
They sent them anyway though and I have pleasure scrathing fuck out of the symantec one while im bored.

Read full topic

item.title: Your kidding me... 1337speak in the news?!
item.dc:creator: @exps35 exps35
item.description:
@exps35 wrote:

lol I seriously dont get it. I dont have to decipher when I read, it just makes sense. how do you NOT see what it means. Obviously a 4 looks like an A and a 7 looks like a T. but an E replaced with a 3, maybe that is just too intense for my mind to handle?

item.title: Your kidding me... 1337speak in the news?!
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

KyleGut3:

Yeah… back in the day it was for more advanced users… but shit. Now non-gamers @ school use lingo that, imo, they shouldn’t be allowed to use. It pisses me off when a complete computer-retard at school says something like “oh my god, i just pawned you.”, etc.

Leet speak was never used by “advanced users”. It’s always been kids who think they’re it.

Read full topic

item.title: Your kidding me... 1337speak in the news?!
item.dc:creator: @The_Cursed The Cursed
item.description:
@The_Cursed wrote:

[quote=“lothy, post:24, topic:59529”]Obviously from one of the under-funded American news stations. So in other words, 0 credibility.
Would you take anything seriously if it came from someone who sounded as annoying as that lady?

EDIT: I laughed at what that parent had to say at the end… It’s only necessary for parents to hold the hand of a 15yr old or so while they’re on the net in stupid countries.[/quote]
lothy, GNIFOC pl0x

Read full topic

item.title: Your kidding me... 1337speak in the news?!
item.dc:creator: @therealjdb JDB`
item.description:
@therealjdb wrote:

[quote=“jme_009, post:21, topic:59529”][quote author=The Un-Named link=topic=85410.msg915920#msg915920 date=1171831848]
I’ve seen this before. Seriously, it’s fucked up. “leet is short for elite, because it’s common for more advanced computer users”. Look at people with no life that have AOL, they probably don’t know shit about “advanced” computer stuff. I mean I’d put partitioning and shit into the intermediate category and how many people with AOL do you know that can create a partition?

I think they make A LOT of shit up just to scare parents so the parents may get more concerned and limit the time their children have on the pc, and/or check up on them. Ok, so I know how to do “1337” speak, but some of the acronyms there are just bullshit. When have you EVER seen someone use “NIFOC” or “GYPO”??
[/quote]

P911 dude![/quote]
OH NOEZ WHERE?!?!?!ELEVEN!!

Read full topic
